events.Name: Grand Ole Opry feat. Carrie Underwood, Darius Rucker, Chris Janson, Charles Esten, and more
events.Description: The Grand Ole Opry is the show that made country music famous. The Opry features a dynamic line-up of new stars, superstars, and legends of country music. Unlike a typical concert, the Opry presents eight or more artists on each show, giving the audience a sample of each artist's musical style. Only the Opry... there's nothing quite like it anywhere else! Scheduled to perform tonight at the Opry are: Carrie Underwood, Darius Rucker, Chris Janson, Charles Esten, and more to be added Schedule Changes: The lineup for each Grand Ole Opry show is not completely finished until just a few days before the show. Artists are posted to the Opry website as soon as appearances are confirmed (artists and schedule subject to change). Plan to check back often, as most times artists' appearances are not confirmed until one to two weeks prior to the show date.

events.Name: Lacuna Coil Stitched up Heart, 9Electric
events.Description: The year is 2014, and the album is ‘BROKEN CROWN HALO’ – it marks the latest chapter in the ongoing LACUNA COIL legacy, a dark and sultry ride that started in Italy and has resonated in an opaque wake of sonic splendor throughout the world. Time has been good to LACUNA COIL, who are a flagship band on Century Media Records and a proven commodity worldwide, in the past two years alone having toured the globe as headliners, as well as in support of Megadeth, Motorhead, Volbeat, Sevendust and Paradise Lost. ‘BROKEN CROWN HALO’ is the band’s seventh studio album, and the highly-anticipated follow-up to ‘Dark Adrenaline’, which was released in January 2012 and debuted at No. 15 on the Billboard Top 200 album chart, helping the band eclipse one million cumulative sales in North America alone.

events.Name: The Heart of Pluto CD Release Concert
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, AMERICANA + BLUEGRASS + FOLK, FREE, GLOBAL
events.Summary: Adventurous instrumental group, The Heart of Pluto, to launch album of original world music for violin, mandolin, mandocello, and more!
events.Description: Nashville-based instrumental duo The Heart of Pluto will perform a show at the Commodore Lounge to celebrate the release of their self-titled debut album. Comprised of multi-instrumentalist Steve Peavey and violinist/fiddler Sarah Wilfong, The Heart of Pluto explores different aspects of world music through original compositions. The duo intersperses their unique originals with a mixture of Irish fiddle tunes, Old-time music, and the occasional Bach piece. The music on The Heart of Pluto album draws from a wide variety of influences and stays cohesive despite the potential for stylistic whiplash. “We didn't set out to write a Celtic/Russian/Bluegrass mash-up plus string section, but that's how the album evolved.” said Sarah. “Steve and I have both been composing for years, but it was the act of writing together really unlocked new ideas. We had a lot of great 'Ah-ha!' moments, and I think the materiel is really fun and well presented.” The Heart of Pluto enlisted the help of of several A list players to carry out their vision, including Grammy winner Jeff Taylor (the Time Jumpers) on accordion, Michael Rinne (Emmylou Harris) on bass, and Chris Wright (Mountain Faith Bluegrass Band, the Willis Clan) pulling double duty as engineer and percussionist. Steve commented, “We took our time recruiting musicians who would interpret our music with authenticity and charisma, and are incredibly pleased with the results.” -Submitted

events.Name: Cale Tyson with Jack Berry and Rick Brantley (DISCOVER Show)
events.Description:
Cale Tyson is a singer and songwriter from Nashville, TN. Born in a small town in Texas, he was raised in Fort Worth, the home of Townes Van Zandt and the place where he first heard the classic country sounds that have inspired and enriched his gentle, melancholy, and undeniably whiskey-soaked sound.

In 2013, Tyson released High On Lonesome, his debut EP, which features Kenny Vaughan (Marty Stuart) on electric guitar. The release was featured on CMT.com and in American Songwriter Magazine, as well as numerous other outlets. Tyson has recently been opening shows for Dwight Yoakam on the road, in addition to wrapping up a new record which heavily features Robert Ellis on guitar and vocals. In April 2014, Tyson was featured as one of PolicyMic’s “9 Real Country Music Stars of Our Generation.” In October 2014, Rolling Stone featured Tyson as one of the "10 New Country Artists You Need To Know."

Smith Music School, will be take place near 5th Avenue and Demonbreun Street in downtown Nashville and will feature performances by Atkins, Craig Campbell, LANco, Canaan Smith and headliner Dustin Lynch.

events.Name: Rhonda Vincent & Daryle Singletary: An Evening of Traditional Country Music
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, AMERICANA + BLUEGRASS + FOLK, CMA MUSIC FESTIVAL, COUNTRY
events.Description: Experience an evening of traditional country music with superstars Rhonda Vincent and Daryle Singletary. Famously crowned as "The New Queen of Bluegrass" by the Wall Street Journal, and the most decorated artist in that field. Rhonda Vincent's music incorporates savvy contemporary touches while drawing deeply from the authentic traditions of classic bluegrass, with a flawless band that can execute break-neck instrumentals to heart wrenching ballads. Her latest project "Taken" features special guests ranging from Dolly Parton to Richard Marx. With over eighty awards to their name, Rhonda Vincent and the Rage are the most celebrated band in bluegrass.- Rhonda Vincent Bio Daryle Singletary earned his notoriety for country authenticity with such unforgettable hits as “I Let Her Lie,” “Too Much Fun,” “Amen Kind of Love” and “The Note.” His newest album, “There’s Still A Little Country Left” , finds the country singer smack dab in the middle of what he loves the most, traditional Country music. On past albums, some of the greatest talents in his industry have lined up to sing with Daryle, including the late George Jones and Johnny Paycheck, Dwight Yoakam, Merle Haggard, Ricky Skaggs, John Anderson and Rhonda Vincent. On “There’s Still A Little Country Left”, Daryle finds harmony vocal assistance from Grand Ole Opry member Vince Gill on the poignant and moving “Say Hello To Heaven.” - Darlye Singletary Bio

events.Name: Kynlie
events.Description: Raised in Nashville, Tennessee, Kynlie grew up surrounded by talented songwriters and eclectic musical influences. She began exploring the world of songwriting at an early age through the music of Carole King, James Taylor, and other classic writers. By the age of thirteen, she had begun to accompany her writing with piano and guitar. Throughout her high school years, Kynlie used her advantage of being based in "Music City" to explore working in various studios and performing live at venues around town. She released her debut album at the age of sixteen and continued to release her original music throughout her teens. -TicketWeb

On the 1st and 3rd Tuesday of every month in East Nashville, Chuck Beard brings together and hosts local writers and musicians in a spectacular show, East Side Storytellin’. events.Summary: Come out and party with us at the NASH Country Kick-Off Party featuring Kelsea Ballerini with special guests Jon Pardi, Levi Hummon and Barret Baber.
events.Description: Looking for a way to get your week of music kick-started? Come out and party with us at the NASH Country Kick-Off Party. Kelsea Ballerini will headline the event with special guests Jon Pardi, Levi Hummon and Barret Baber. Kelsea’s 2015 debut album, The First Time, spawned two No. 1 singles, “Love Me Like You Mean It” and “Dibs.” Her current single, “Peter Pan,” is flying up the charts as Kelsea continues hitting the road with Billy Currington’s Summer Forever Tour. She will join Rascal Flatts’ Rhythm and Roots Tour in June. All proceeds from the NASH Country Kick-Off Party benefit Musicians On Call, an organization that brings live and recorded music to the bedsides of patients in healthcare facilities. Special thanks to Coca-Cola, Walmart, Durango and Roper. -Submitted

events.Name: Happy Together Tour 2016
events.Summary: Lineup includes hosts The Turtles Featuring Flo & Eddie, Chuck Negron formerly of Three Dog Night, Mark Lindsay formerly of Paul Revere & The Raiders, Gary Puckett & The Union Gap, The Cowsills, and The Spencer Davis Group Starring Spencer Davis.
events.Description: The celebrated Happy Together Tour, featuring the best musical talent of the sixties and seventies, returns to Nashville. This year the tour includes six headline artists with a total of 59 Billboard hits amongst them. The acclaimed yearly summer tour is going into its 7th consecutive year and delivers the biggest hits of the legendary time in culture and music, alongside first-class media production. The unparalleled lineup includes hosts The Turtles Featuring Flo & Eddie, Chuck Negron formerly of Three Dog Night, Mark Lindsay formerly of Paul Revere & The Raiders, Gary Puckett & The Union Gap, The Cowsills, and The Spencer Davis Group Starring Spencer Davis. The Happy Together Tour began in 1984 with mainstays The Turtles. It started up again in 2010. The overwhelming response and love for the music has endured, and The Happy Together Tour brings that magic back to fans, night after night.

events.Name: Stryper
events.Description: Without a doubt, Stryper is one of the top Christian rock bands of all-time, and certainly the most celebrated Christian metal band of all time. Comprised of Michael Sweet (vocals/guitar), Oz Fox (guitar), Tim Gaines (bass), and Robert Sweet (drums), Stryper has been rocking since 1983, and is responsible for such '80s metal classic albums as 'Soldiers Under Command,' 'To Hell with the Devil,' In God We Trust,' and such MTV hit singles/videos as "Calling on You," "Free," and "Honestly." After a sabbatical for much of the 1990's, Stryper returned strong in the early 21st century. But it was not until their 2011 covers set, 'The Covering,' that the aforementioned definitive Stryper was reinstated, as the band welcomed Gaines back into the fold.

events.Name: Marty Stuart's Late Night Jam
events.Description: GRAMMY-winner and American music icon Marty Stuart will release his second album for Sugar Hill Records entitled Nashville, Volume 1: Tear The Woodpile Down on April 24th. The ten song collection, almost entirely written by Marty, features his touring band of musical missionaries The Fabulous Superlatives. Nashville staples Buck Trent, Kenny Lovelace, and Robbie Turner are joined by country music royalty Hank Williams III and Lorrie Carter Bennett (The Carter Family) on harmony vocals to fill out the cast.

events.Name: Music City Roots feat. The McCrary Sisters, Sarah Potenza, Christine Ohlman, Bonnie Bramlett
events.venueName: Liberty Hall at the Factory in Franklin
events.Description:
Music City Roots, Live From Liberty Hall at the Factory in Franklin is a weekly, two-hour radio show that revives the historic legacy of live musical production. Broadcast on Wednesday nights on Hippie Radio 94.5 on Wednesday nights from 7:00pm to 9:00pm,CST, Music City Roots,  showcases Nashville's astonishing music scene, from country and Americana to more progressive interpreters of tradition -- a "roots and branches" format that brings together fans of different tastes and generations.

Music fans worldwide know Nashville as the epicenter of country music, and Music City Roots embraces and builds on that foundation. MCR is broadcast to a global audience, not just as the keeper of the traditional flame, but as a trusted tastemaker that looks to the future of music in all its forms and sub-genres: bluegrass, folk, alternative, western, rockabilly and crossovers into rock, jazz and world music. There has never been a time of greater variety, abundance and quality in Nashville's creative community, and Music City Roots looks to put that talent on a worldwide stage.

Each broadcast will feature 4-5 artists in 20 minute segments and short interviews, and also encourages collaboration with a nightly Jam where all musical guests embrace the spirit of Music City as the collaborative epicenter of tradition and innovation. Nashville’s legendary Keith Bilbrey is the announcer; Jim Lauderdale and other leaders of the music community host the festivities.

This week will feature the The McCrary Sisters, Sarah Potenza, Christine Ohlman, Bonnie Bramlett!

events.TicketInfo: $20/General Admission $100/VIP Meet and Greet: Includes One (1) VIP admission, Early entry to the venue and priority seating, Meet & Greet with photo opportunity with Clay Walker at 6:00pm, One (1) limited edition poster, One (1) commemorative VIP laminate $250/Table of 10 On Sale Mon, 04/25 10:00AM
events.Description: Annually, friends and supporters of Clay Walker and Band Against MS gather in Nashville, TN to celebrate an evening of great entertainment. This event serves as the largest local Nashville fundraiser for Band Against MS and also benefits Multiple Sclerosis research at Vanderbilt Medical Center. Band Against MS, Inc. is a 501 (c) (3), or not-for-profit, public charity committed to providing educational information for those living with Multiple Sclerosis, funding programs researching a cure for Multiple Sclerosis, and funding programs helping those living with the disease. Clay Walker established BAMS in February 2003 because he wanted to help others living with the same disease he has battled since 1996.

events.Name: Jessie Smith at Cafe Fontanella
events.Summary: Join Cafe Fontanella for dinner, drinks, and a little bit of music. Part of their On Stage music series at Fontanel Nashville.
events.Description: Jessie Smith’s muddy river musicality courses through Al Green, Gladys Knight, Billie Holiday, Mavis Staple singers, Sam Cook, Otis Redding, the haunting tradition of field hollers, and the messy side of life for a dark, redemptive quality. Jessie’s talent as a musician was apparent as far back as high school where she was entrusted to sing for graduation and, later, recruited to sing opera on scholarship for Mercer University. She finished college at Belmont University in Nashville, specializing in commercial music. Upon graduation, she apprenticed in the pop country industry, worked at an esteemed Triple A radio station, and lent her vocal gifts to demo recordings for songwriters and publishers. Her singing prowess in this context caught the attention of a respected label putting together a singing group. Jessie passed on the opportunity and instead worked briefly with one of the other artists, eventually joining him and his band on a month-long tour. That experience would be formative, imbuing Jessie with the confidence and bravery to search for the pure music within, away from the whims of the industry.

events.Name: Richard Dubois
events.Description:
Richard DuBois lives in East Nashville. He's been there for a long time. He's originally from Walden, NY. It's a farm town, but a circus lives there now.

Okay, but what does Richard’s music sound like? Well, Richard says he owes a great debt to both Elvises, both Heartbreakers, and two out of three Hanks. Jim Ridley of the Nashville Scene says, “Richard DuBois connects the dots between Eddie Cochran and Paul Westerberg.” And over the years, at least eight people have said that Richard’s music sounds something like Tom Petty meets the Replacements and the Stones. What do you think? Check out the tunes...

events.Name: Anne McCue
events.Description: McCue’s virtuosity is no surprise, but the ease with which she’s absorbed and restated the beating heart of swing music is impressive and thrilling.

events.Name: Natalie Lurie w/ Charlie Whitten
events.Description: Hailed as one of "5 harpists who really nail experimental pop music" (Paste Magazine), Natalie Lurie is a classically-trained harpist and singer-songwriter based in Nashville. She began her studies on the harp when she was seven years old. In lieu of her senior year at high school, she studied at the Jerusalem Academy of Music and Dance and completed her Bachelors of Music at Indiana University under world-renowned harpist, Susann McDonald. Natalie has participated in international music festivals in France such as Académie Internationale de Musique and Féstival des Arcs where she studied with notable harpists such as Isabelle Moretti (Paris Conservatory), Isabelle Perrin (Ecole Normale de Musique), Germaine Lorenzini (Lyon Orchestra), and Marie-Pierre Langlamet (Berlin Philharmonic). In her senior year at Indiana University, she won the prestigious Harp Concerto competition and performed the Concerto di Aranjuez as the featured soloist. Last year, she was invited to participate in masterclasses and perform at the 150th anniversary celebration of Lyon & Healy, the world's leading harp manufacturers. -TicketWeb

events.Name: Handsom Jack, Lauren Strange and the Pretty Killers, Treadwell Ford
events.Description: Treadwell Ford is a four-piece band from Nashville, TN. Singer and rhythm guitar player Curtis Ford and drummer Justin Smith started playing music together two years ago and lead guitar player Dylan Alldredge and bassist Matt Wyman quickly came into the picture the following year. The name comes from an old car dealership that Curtis's father worked for while he was growing up. -TicketWeb

events.Name: 2016 CMT Music Awards
events.Description: 2016 marks the 15th year of the CMT Music Awards, country music’s first fan-voted awards show recognizing country's best video and musical achievements. The CMT Music Awards is consistently the channel's highest rated and most-watched event of the year. Since its inception, the CMT Music Awards has become the hallmark of CMT's impact on the industry and contribution to the culture of country music. Performances and appearances by the biggest names in entertainment highlight the appeal that drives millions of consumers to vote and watch as their favorite contemporary artists and American icons gather for this annual celebration of the fans and the music. Past celebrities include: Blake Shelton, Kristen Bell, Lady Antebellum, Carrie Underwood, Rascal Flatts, Taylor Swift, Miley Cyrus, Brad Paisley, Dolly Parton, Dierks Bentley, Tim McGraw, Faith Hill, Keith Urban, Toby Keith, Kenny Chesney, Shania Twain, Kid Rock, Sheryl Crow, T Pain and more.

events.Name: CMA Music Festival Opening Cermonies featuring Chris Young
events.Description:
Country star Chris Young will kick off the 2016 CMA Music Festival Wednesday, June 8 (11:00 AM/CT) at the Festival’s new, state-of-the-art venue – Skyview Stage at Ascend Amphitheater.

“We are always looking at ways to grow the Festival and enhance the experience for our fans,” said CMA Chief Executive Officer Sarah Trahern. “Adding this fantastic venue to our numerous free stages downtown is a great addition and having Chris Young on hand to make it ‘official’ is icing on the cake.”

Special guests for the CMA Music Festival Opening Ceremonies include the Honorable Mayor of Nashville Megan Barry, the Fisk Jubilee Singers, and students from Metro Nashville Public Schools, a beneficiary of the Festival and the CMA Foundation’s support of quality, sustainable music education programs. -CMA Music Festival Press Release

events.Name: CMT Awards Watch Party
events.Description: Watch the 2016 CMT Awards on their huge projector and listen to the live performances through their BOSE sound system. Enjoy drink specials and listen to their own employees performing live original music during commercial breaks of the award show! -The Listening Room

events.Name: Missy Raines & The New Hip Band
events.Description: Missy Raines & The New Hip has the right recipe: start with bluegrass virtuosity. Add in a jazz-tinged groove and a song-driven sensibility. Dish it up with a hot band of young players. Here's a group that moves easily from fun, funky instrumentals to sophisticated songs of longing and hope. She may be a multiple-time International Bluegrass Music Association's Bass Player of the Year, but Missy colors far outside the lines of the style she started out in. With the New Hip she leads a group of fearless, gifted players who are at ease in almost any genre. Together they are reshaping the acoustic landscape. Time to dust off the old superlatives: missy raines & the the new hip *is* new, hip and fresh.

events.Name: Quiles & Cloud
events.Description: Quiles & Cloud is a San Francisco-based acoustic band made up of Maria Quiles (voice and guitar), Rory Cloud (voice and guitar) and Oscar Westesson (upright bass).

events.Description: The 2016 CMA Music Festival™ runs Thursday through Sunday, June 9-12 in downtown Nashville with numerous free stages and unique fan experiences, the most anticipated events are the Nightly Concerts at Nissan Stadium. Jason Aldean, Charlie Daniels Band, Dierks Bentley, Miranda Lambert and Rascal Flatts will perform live at Nissan Stadium on Thursday, June 9. The Oak Ridge Boys will sing the National Anthem.

events.secondaryType: MUSIC, FOOD + DRINK, FREE, TASTINGS + EVENTS
events.Description: Discover the story behind the lyrics and the person behind the voice. Uncorked and Unplugged features intimate performances from songwriters in our beautiful Natchez Hills Winery Tasting Room at Fontanel.

events.Name: Music on Main featuring Bucky Covington
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, COUNTRY, FREE, ROCK + POP
events.Summary: Bring a lawn chair for live music on Main Street!
events.Description: Enjoy free music with the Music on Main concert series in Portland, Tennessee. Tonight's performance features Bucky Covington with special guest Addison Johnson! Bucky Covington’s self titled debut CD opened at #1 on Billboard’s Top Country Albums chart with the biggest first week sales for any debut country artist that year. He went on to become the best selling debut artist of 2007 and delivered three consecutive Top 10 singles to country radio (“Different World”, “I’ll Walk”, and “Good To Be Us”), and a total of six charted singles. In addition to competing on the fifth season of American Idol, Bucky’s national television appearances have included Good Morning America, Live with Regis and Kelly!, Jimmy Kimmel Live!, The Tonight Show and Fox & Friends. Bucky’s recent singles include last summer’s feel good tune “Buzzin”, and “Drinking Side of Country” (duet with Shooter Jennins), which reached over Two Million views on YouTube in only two short days following its premiere and features cameos by country stars Kellie Pickler, Shooter Jennings, and other celebrity friends. Bucky recently released his first independent project in the form of a six song EP titled, “Happy Man”, which has produced two singles charting on Music Row charts so far. Covington co-produced the project alongside his long time producer, Grammy nominated Dale Oliver.

events.Name: Alicia Beale w/ Alaina Cross, The Medicine Man
events.Description: Hailing from Southeast Texas, Nashville singer/songwriter, Alicia Beale, knows how to bring it. Beale fronted hundreds of shows all over Music City and beyond, where she learned how to command a crowd. From 2008 to 2010, she paid for college by playing late nights down on lower Broadway in Nashville. In 2010, she founded the country Duo, Autumn Rose (prod. by Garth Fundis); and in 2014, she toured with Angelo Petraglia (Kings of Leon), and his wife, Eulene, as a background vocalist in their band, The Jane Shermans; and in late fall, began crowdfunding for her solo project. Alicia has been busy this past year (2015), writing and recording her solo, debut record, full of fun, dance beats and soaring vocals, with Mike Gossin (Gloriana), which is set for release Spring 2016.

events.Name: Lee Rascone's Writers Night
events.Description: Come to Lee Rascone’s Writer’s Night featuring special guests at Maxwell’s Lounge in the Millennium Maxwell House Hotel!

events.Name: Jamiroquai
events.Description: Jamiroquai Tribute: Celebrating 25 years of Traveling Without Moving, ft Marquee Mayfield & Mr. Moons -  ft. Optimus Funk (tribute to D'Angelo) - ft. Amber Woodhouse (tribute to Alicia Keys)

events.Name: Ole Mossy Face with Jennifer Niceley
events.Description: Ole Mossy Face is no overnight sensation. More like a wild beast that's been running loose in Nashville, Tennessee for far too long. Nashvillians who remember places like the Radio Cafe, Guido's and the Boardroom have cornered them over the years. But now, at last, they've been captured. We have the Golden Egg. Born from Emac's studio after years of sessions worked in as the best they could. Preceded by a countless nights of rehearsals and those occasional, glorious gigs. If you've caught them in action, you've been waiting for this. Ole Mossy Face's Golden Egg. You found it. ~D. Striker, Nashville, TN, 2014

events.Name: Sixwire & Friends
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, COUNTRY, ROCK + POP
events.Description: After years of touring, recording, and writing songs as sidemen for some of the biggest names in music, Andy Childs, Steve Mandile, Robb Houston, John Howard, and Chuck Tilley joined forces to form the guitar and vocal powered band Sixwire. Sixwire’s album for Warner Brothers Records debuted in the top 30, and spawned the hits ‘Look At Me Now’ and 'Way Too Deep'. After a stint as house band on USA Network’s NASHVILLE STAR, Sixwire temporarily moved to Los Angeles to join the cast of FOX Television’s NEXT GREAT AMERICAN BAND. Their television work has also included being house band on CMT’s CAN YOU DUET, CMT’s NEXT SUPERSTAR and ABC’s new dramatic series NASHVILLE. Sixwire's monthly concert series at 3rd & Lindsley features a variety of guest artists including classic rock stars, country legends, hit song-writers, and frequent appearances by members of the cast of ABC's 'Nashville'. - SUBMITTED

events.Name: An Acoustic Afternoon with Kree Harrison
events.Description: Join 3rd and Lindsley for the 2016 Kree Harrison Fan Club Party!  It will be held during CMA Fest on Thursday, June 9th. The ticket price includes entry to Kree’s private performance, featuring songs from her upcoming album This Old Thing.  After the show, there will be a meet & greet where attendees can get a photo with Kree!  This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to hear some of the songs from Kree’s debut album before it’s out! The purchase of a ticket also includes a 1 year membership to Kree's fan club and a koozie. Lunch and drinks will be available for purchase during the show. - SUBMITTED

Come see The Stars of Tomorrow as admission is free. Artists here is your chance to showcase your music here in Nashville and get a HD video of your performance.

events.Name: Lewis Del Mar, R.LUM.R
events.Description: Lewis Del Mar, a duo from Rockaway Beach in Queens, NY, is the project of two lifelong friends who have crafted a sound as challenging as it is comforting. Their sonic hybrid blends barefaced bedroom recordings of acoustic guitars and soulful vocals over a rich soundscape of complex live and sampled percussion. -TicketWeb

events.Name: Chris Mitchell Presents: James Wold, Chris Burke and Chris Mitchell and the Collection
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, AMERICANA + BLUEGRASS + FOLK, COUNTRY, ROCK + POP
events.Summary: Chris Mitchell Presents: James Wold, Chris Burke and Chris Mitchell and the Collection on June 9th at 8:30PM.
events.Description: James Wold:  James Wold grew up in Chicago,IL and was raised in a musical family. He began singing and doing voice-over work for jingles at age 7 and by 15 was playing professionally in bands and as a solo performer. Moving to Nashville in 2003,he worked steadily as a session musician,background vocalist and songwriter. His songs have been featured in "The young and the restless" and have been recorded by artists as diverse as America, Melissa Manchester, U.K. Singer Toni Christie, Alanna Myles, Blue Oyster Cult's Buck Dharma and Tiffany. Chris Burke: Birmingham, Alabama Native Chris Burke thrills audiences with his velvet vocals, neo-soul/pop style and combination of contemporary neo-soul/pop with the classic sounds of Stax and Motown. His style ranges effortlessly from the grit of Stevie Wonder, to the smooth R&B of Luther Vandross. With producer Bobby King, Chris has released several recording projects, including 4 full length albums of both original material and covers, as well as a handful of singles. He worked closely with famed songwriter Mike Reid on his newest project, ‘I Can’t Make You Love Me: The Mike Reid SongBook,’ where he recorded soulful versions of many of Reid’s classic songs. http://www.chrisburkemusic.com/ Chris Mitchell:  Akron Ohio native Chris Mitchell loves to sing and is almost always doing what he loves. In 2012 Chris recorded a very popular version of Madonna's "Like A Virgin" for the major motion picture Magic Mike.  Even though the song was not included on the soundtrack, it exposed his music and voice to hundred's of thousands of new fans worldwide. In the late 1990’s, Mitchell reigned supreme over the Nashville party scene and fans flocked to see what he would do next with his band The Collection, a spectacle that included hot pants, feather boas, choir robes, nonstop dance grooves, and the best vocals anyone had ever heard in a Nashville club. Chris Mitchell and The Collection opened for The Ohio Players, Parliament Funkadelic, and KC & The Sunshine Band just to name a few.

events.Name: Jamie Lynn Spears Sleepover Fan Party
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, CMA MUSIC FESTIVAL, COUNTRY, FREE
events.Description: At 23 years-old Jamie Lynn Spears is already a seasoned entertainment veteran. After five years focused on raising her daughter, Maddie, the Kentwood, LA native is back in the spotlight with a sound and style that truly captures her Southern roots. Her official music debut comes in the form of country ballad “How Could I Want More.” The intensely personal lyrics mixed with a simple song production portrays Jamie Lynn as wise beyond her 23 years. “How Could I Want More” was written by Spears along with Nashville songwriter Rivers Rutherford, who has also collaborated with Tim McGraw, Brad Paisley, and Montgomery Gentry. -Bio JamieLynnSpears.com Join the Sleepover party with Jamie Lynn Spears! Liz Rose, Jessie James Decker, Alyssa Micaela, April Kry, Chelsea Gill, and Indigo Summer all perform for the Jamie Lynn Spears Fan party!

events.Name: Rob Ickes, Trey Hensley and Friends
events.Description: Rob Ickes is a dobro (resonator guitar) player. A Northern California native (b. 1967), Rob Ickes [rhymes with "bikes"] moved to Nashville in 1992 and joined the contemporary bluegrass band Blue Highway as a founding member in 1994. In addition to his work with Blue Highway, he also regularly performs with Three Ring Circle and his own jazz trio. In 2011, he was named Dobro Player of the Year for the thirteenth time by the International Bluegrass Music Association. IBMA notes that he is the most awarded instrumentalist in the history of the IBMA Awards. Photo: Credit Michael Witcher.

events.Name: Grand Ole Opry feat. Alan Jackson, Oak Ridge Boys, Charley Pride, Easton Corbin, Scotty McCreery, Larry Gatlin & The Gatlin Brothers, and more to be added

Unlike a typical concert, the Opry presents eight or more artists on each show, giving the audience a sample of each artist's musical style. events.Name: Hadley Kennary
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, AMERICANA + BLUEGRASS + FOLK, FREE
events.Summary: Music beats through the vines at Natchez Hills and they love host up and coming talent on their stage for you to enjoy.
events.Description:
Hadley Kennary is a singer-songwriter whose music is a folk/pop blend of heartfelt, clever lyrics and infectious melodies. Kennary, appropriately pronounced like the bird, started writing music when she was just 14. Now 22, she has a self-titled EP, a full-length album, and graduated from the prestigious Berklee College of Music. Her warm sound is refreshingly honest and contagiously catchy.

She has graced stages around the country such as SPACE in Chicago and the Bluebird Cafe in Nashville, as well as several shows in Ireland and the UK. She also appeared on ABC Chicago's "Windy City Live" in July 2014, where she played to an audience of 250,000+. Most notably, she was named a finalist for both the Rocky Mountain Folks Festival Songwriter Showcase and the Telluride Bluegrass Festival Troubadour Songwriting Contest, in which she won 2nd place in June of 2015.

Hadley lives in Nashville, Tennessee where she continues to write, record, and perform live.

events.Name: SNAP ON 2&4 with Roland Barber
events.TicketInfo: $25/Ticket or $15/High School & College StudentsTickets will go on sale Monday, May 30 at 10:00am. Advance purchase is strongly recommended.
events.StartTime: There will be two sets beginning at 8:00pm in the Jazz Cave at the Workshop.
events.Summary: Roland has performed in venues such as Carnegie Hall, Birdland, the Blue Note, Lincoln Center, the Copacabana, and Madison Square Garden. He has also appeared on television, including MTV's "Making the Band."
events.Description: Roland Barber has performed with an impressively diverse and world class list of musicians, including Aretha Franklin, Victor Wooten, Christian McBride, the Grammy-Award-Winning New Orleans Jazz Orchestra, Take 6, Lauryn Hill, Stefon Harris, Manny Oquendo y Libre, Chaka Khan, Wynton Marsalis and the JLCO, the Duke Ellington Orchestra, and the NBC Saturday Night Live Band. Roland is also quite active as a teacher and educator of musicians from all walks of life. He has taught private study of trombone, jazz history, big band, and jazz improvisation in Manhattan School of Music’s Pre-College Program for the NYC area’s talented youngsters. Roland proudly teaches Nashville's youth as a part of the Nashville Symphony's "One Note, One Neighborhood" program - a partnership between the Nashville Symphony and W. O. Smith Community School of Music - and he is also on faculty here at the Nashville Jazz Workshop. Also, Roland has presented master classes, lessons and lectures to audiences from the very young to high school and collegiate levels. Roland Barber is also an esteemed composer and arranger. He was awarded a New Works Jazz Grant from Chamber Music America, which led to the writing and Lincoln Center premier of his suite, "Songs of the Village", performed by his quintet. Policies: The Jazz Cave is a BYOB establishment, with no alcohol or food service. You are free to bring alcoholic beverages and snacks. We sell soft drinks and bottled water. The Jazz Cave is a listening room, and we ask patrons to keep conversation to a minimum and silence cell phones. Audio and video recording is prohibited.

events.Summary: At The Bluebird, performers include up-and-coming songwriters along with those whose music is regularly on the charts, country music as well as pop, rock and Contemporary Christian hits.

events.Name: Girls Up Loud! with Guests
events.Description: Girls Up LOUD, created by Fleming McWilliams and Laura Donohue, is a singing experience for middle and high school girls. GUL consists of camps, workshops, and singalongs, all designed to empower girls through the use of their voices, and to build strong connections through music. At Girls Up LOUD we believe everyone has a beautiful, powerful voice, and that every voice is important.

events.Name: Sister C Live at CMA Fest
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, COMMUNITY, COUNTRY, CULTURAL, FESTIVALS, FREE, MUSIC
events.Description: For country music trio Sister C, music literally runs in the family. Made up of real-life sisters Cirby, Carli, and Celbi Manchaca, these three young women blend their love of traditional country with an edgy twist for a unique and alternative style that gives their music a signature sound. Sister C is a force to be reckoned with in country music.  Each sister brings her individual talents, distinct voice, and personality to the group.  Cirby's natural energy and strong personality provides a perfect foil to Carli's instinctive ability to push the limits lyrically and Celbi's prowess on guitar. With all of their combined, organic talent, Sister C is a breath of fresh air.  Regardless of whether they’re in the studio or onstage, when Cirby, Carli, and Celbi are together, magic is in the air. Demo Sessions, Vol. 1 is a diverse release that showcases Sister C’s vocal strengths and natural songwriting abilities - talents that have earned them accolades in staple country-music publications like Rolling Stone Country, Nash Country Weekly, The Boot, and Taste of Country. Along with frequent radio airplay and their ongoing Blue Room Sessions, Sister C is ready to take Nashville by storm. With new music on the way, the sky's the limit and the future is bright for Sister C.

events.Name: Big Thief
events.Description: Every once in a while, a band comes along that leaves expectations, cynicism, and emotional distance ruined in a heap on the floor. Brooklyn's Big Thief is that band. To hear songwriter Adrianne Lenker's lilting narratives and twisted, fuzzy guitars is to love them. Lenker's lyrical storytelling is equally grounded and autobiographical as it is surreal and cabalistic. -TicketWeb

events.Summary: Southern Trace will host a night of great music at Douglas on June 10th starting at 6PM. The cover is $10
events.Description: Southern Trace Songwriters is a full service booking, promotion, and management company. It has booked showcases with artists such as Shannon Lawson (hit songwriter), Tina Shafer (hit songwriter, head of NY Songwriters Circle), Jenna Torres, Vickie Raye, and Craig Wilson. In the past Southern Trace Songwriters has worked with global touring artists such as Steven Mastro (Christian artist), and Mississippi Millie (Delta blues artist) to name a few. Currently, Southern Trace Songwriters is working with artists Liz Moriondo, Brittany Marie, and Blane Howard. Southern Trace Songwriters looks forward to what the future holds in this ever changing business.

events.Name: Ray Wylie Hubbard with Aaron Lee Tasjan
events.Description: When it comes to down ’n’ dirty roots ’n’ roll, nobody in the wide world of Americana music today does it better than Ray Wylie Hubbard. Except, it seems, for Hubbard himself. After riding a decade-long career resurgence into the national spotlight with 2012’s acclaimed The Grifter’s Hymnal and his first ever appearance on the Late Show With David Letterman (“I didn’t want to peak too soon,” quips Hubbard, 68), the iconoclastic Texas songwriter is back to continue his hot streak with The Ruffian’s Misfortune — his 16th album (and third on his own Bordello Records, via Thirty Tigers).

events.Name: Pierce Avenue
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, CMA MUSIC FESTIVAL, COUNTRY, FREE
events.Description: One could say Pierce Avenue is in perfect harmony. Made up of husband and wife Tony and Jaime Pierce, the duo has paired their love with their affinity for music, meshing their solo chops to create a soulful, southern-fringed sound unique to most up-and-coming Nashville hopefuls. Embracing their authentic country roots with twang and sass, the high-octane duo delivers high-energy performances laced with flawless harmonies that leave no doubt in the listener the two have become one.Tony and Jaime joined forces professionally in January 2013. In October 2013, they released their first single as a duo to iTunes, Take It To The House. They released their debut EP to iTunes in October 2014. Along with producer Jimmy Dulin (who produced Take It to the House, Shut Up & Love Me) and engineer Todd Tidwell, Pierce Avenue produced and co-wrote on all five tracks. In June 2014, Pierce Avenue released a YouTube video of their 'country' cover of John Legend's All of Me that has had over 56,000 views to date! In April of 2015, it became available on iTunes to purchase. In January 2016, Pierce Avenue joined the roster as one of the acts booked by Ken McMeans Presents Booking Agency out of California. -Facebook Band Page

events.Name: Colby Dee
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, CMA MUSIC FESTIVAL, COUNTRY, FREE
events.Description: Colby Dee made the move to Nashville in 2011 to focus on her music career full time, learning from the very best in the industry. She now hosts her own rounds, inviting other artists to share the stage with her, at a variety of well-known Nashville venues and also joins other hosted rounds in Music City as well. Her live shows are where she is really at home….. on stage….any stage. Her shows are high energy and she engages all of her audience, whether it’s a small private venue or in front of thousands of people. -Facebook Bio

events.Name: Elise Hayes & Friends
events.Description: Sometimes it’s a haunting melody or playful lyric that hooks a person when they hear a song. Elise Hayes draws you in from the first note she sings. With a voice described as “powerfully sweet” and “blissful”, Elise effectively blends thoughtful and expressive songwriting with soulful and heartfelt vocals. -Facebook

events.Name: Chris Jones & The Nightdrivers
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, AMERICANA + BLUEGRASS + FOLK, COUNTRY
events.Summary: Jones has performed as a sideman at the Grand Ole Opry and has been seen on such television shows as Conan O'Brien, Emeril Live, and The Grand Ole Opry Live.
events.Description: Chris Jones is no newcomer to the musical spotlight. His resume includes appearances and recordings with some of the world's most respected musicians including The Chieftains (he was featured on their 2003 U.S. tour), Earl Scruggs, Vassar Clements, Lynn Morris Band, April Verch Band, the McCarters and the award-winning quartet Weary Hearts, among others. He has performed as a sideman at the Grand Ole Opry and has been seen on such television shows as Conan O'Brien, Emeril Live, and The Grand Ole Opry Live. Jones' collaboration with legendary country singer/songwriter Tom T. Hall led to the release of the duet "Man On The Side Of The Road" from Chris'  "Just a Drifter" album, which became one of the Top 5 airplay bluegrass songs of 2001. He also appeared in the PBS series "The Appalachians" as a both a performer and commentator.

events.Name: Musicians Corner | Matthew Perryman Jones & Friends, John Fullbright, Mike Hicks, and Slings & Arrows
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, AMERICANA + BLUEGRASS + FOLK, CMA MUSIC FESTIVAL, COMMUNITY, CULTURAL, FAMILY FUN, FESTIVALS, FREE, PRE-K, PRE-TEENS, ROCK + POP, TEENS, YOUTH
events.Summary: Enter to Win a Musicians Corner Prize Pack for 2 including certificates of your choice of two Musicians Corner T Shirts, two bottles of American Music Water, two bottles of Coca Cola products, or two tickets to the MC Pub (21+ only)!
events.Description: Musicians Corner’s Spring 2016 Season will take place on four Fridays on May 13, 20, June 17, 24 and seven Saturdays on May 14, 21, 28, June 4, 11, 18, 25. Events will feature multi-genre artist performances on the SunTrust Main Stage and Lightning 100 Acoustic Stage, Mix 92.9 Kidsville activities, several of Nashville's best food trucks, Dogville activities, local artisans, Featured Charity Partners, and the Musicians Corner Pub. This week's Musicians Corner features live music by Matthew Perryman Jones & Friends, John Fullbright, Mike Hicks, and Slings & Arrows! Musicians Corner is a central point, free and open to all, where Music City gathers to perform and enjoy its music. Music in all forms. Music to entertain us, build bridges within our community, welcome our visitors and connect us with the world. Inspired by "Speaker's Corner" in London and Nashville's hunger for free outdoor music programming, Musicians Corner illustrates the diversity, passion, and fellowship of Music City. The Spring 2016 Season will see the debut of Musicians Corner’s permanent home, built as part of phase one of the Centennial Park Restoration -- a native woodland landscape woven with paths and benches, crab orchard stone seating, and gently graded slopes for blankets and picnicking, located at the corner of West End Avenue and 27th Street.

events.Name: Taylor Martin Band
events.Summary: Join Cafe Fontanella for dinner, drinks, and a little bit of music. Part of their On Stage music series at Fontanel Nashville.
events.Description: The Taylor Martin Band are craftsman, the kind whose boundless desire to hone their skills and relentless pursuit of perfection are matched only by their humility about the entire process. The band is made of bassist Chuck Feltner, drummer Drew Kugler, and frontman Taylor Martin. Their music is a showcase for their pain staking approach to writing and recording. Taylor Martin's raw backwoods grit vocals are the building blocks of the bands sound. They strive for genuine sound that crosses into multiple genres.

events.Name: Mike Mueller
events.Summary: Natchez Hills is all about Music and Wine!
events.Description: Rhythm and Vine is a music series every Saturday and Sunday in the tasting room or on the patio depending on the weather. This free concert series will showcase some regular performing artists as well as new and upcoming Nashville Talent. So grab your friends and come spend the weekends with a bottle of wine and Rhythm & Vine. From the heart of Dairyland USA comes country music’s next big thing. Mike Mueller grew up on 80’s Hair Metal and 90’s Pop and Rock music, until he started his job as a farm hand at 12 where he fell in love with country music. “I had never listened to country music before I started working on the farm and one of the first songs I heard on the radio was George Strait's Write This Down. I was hooked immediately.” As Mike got older he fell more and more in love with performing and writing country music, so he set his sights for Nashville, August 2014. Unfortunately, a person does not just come to Nashville and a couple months later become a superstar. There is a lot of hard work that gets put into the craft and a network of loyal people you need to build relationships with to make things work and Mike did just that when he moved. Mike has been critically acclaimed by country superstars Florida Georgia Line for his cover of their multi-platinum hit single, Cruise on his YouTube page (muellertime100), which has led to endless opportunities. He has gotten to know staff members over at Big Loud Shirt Publishing to point him in the right direction and meet and write with some of the biggest people in town. While Mike is still an act in the making and gaining experience, every opportunity he gets he makes the most of. He provides and upbeat good/fun vibe to his live shows that connects directly with his audience. Mike is beginning to set up his tour for the summer and fall of 2016 and hopes to travel all across the country to continue to grow his fan base organically. As he continues to grow as an artist and songwriter, he plans to stay true to his country roots to provide quality entertainment and an up-tempo vibe for any occasion.

events.Name: Opry at the Ryman Matinee feat. Kristian Bush, Margo Price, Jamie Lynn Spears, and more
events.Description: The show that made country music famous returns to its most famous home, the Historic Ryman Auditorium in downtown Nashville. At the Opry, you can count on things happening you just can't see anywhere else. Scheduled to perform tonight at the Opry are: Kristian Bush, Margo Price, Jamie Lynn Spears, and more Schedule Changes: The lineup for each Grand Ole Opry show is not completely finished until just a few days before the show. Artists are posted to the Opry website as soon as appearances are confirmed (artists and schedule subject to change). Plan to check back often, as most times artists' appearances are not confirmed until one to two weeks prior to the show date.

events.Name: Mary Bragg with Adam James
events.Description:
Some ask why a rural Georgia girl would spend 10 years in New York City, so far from home, from the capital of country music, from everything familiar. But when she was barely out of high school, Mary Bragg spent 6 months in Nashville as a sprite, eager singer, like so many – looking to be discovered. During one especially memorable meeting on Music Row, after hearing her homespun demo, an executive responded, “Honey, you ain’t got nothing to say. Go out there and live a little – come back to me in 10 years.”

And so, she lived. New York was her muse, her trouble, her chaperone. Three albums later, Nashville’s magnetism has brought her back to the South – with many a story to tell.
After several years of growing acclaim on the Brooklyn Americana scene, she attracted overflow crowds for a year-long residency at NYC’s famed venue The Living Room. Her latest recording, Tattoos and Bruises, is a reflection of that series of shows. Produced by one of the genre’s contemporary icons, Lee Alexander (Norah Jones, Amos Lee), the album was recorded and mixed at The Coop, the studio belonging to him and his long-time collaborator, Norah Jones.

events.Name: An Appeal To Heaven Tour w/ The Death in Me, Pathway Home and more
events.Description: The An Appeal to Heaven tour is making a stop in Nashville! The Death in Me with Pathway Home, Conquer the Distance, Fight to Remain, and Chariot the Moon will perform.

events.Name: Brian Collins
events.Summary: Brian Collins will be playing Douglas on June 11th at 6PM. The show is free!
events.Description: Hailing from the music hotbed of West Georgia, Brian’s hard working nature and undeniable talent have led him to share the stage with KISS, Will Hoge, Love and Theft, Sister Hazel, James Otto, Colin Hay (of Men At Work), Zac Brown Band, The Smithereens, Marshall Tucker Band, Georgia Satellites, Edwin McCain, Blackberry Smoke, Alabama, Lynyrd Skynyrd and more. His debut single "Never Really Left" led Brian to be named an 'Artist to Watch' by CMA, Billboard, and CMT. Brian claimed the title of highest independent charting artist on the MusicRow Country Breakout Chart with his uplifting sophomore single "Shine A Little Love" which celebrated national media recognition and went No. 1 on CMT's Pure 12-Pack Countdown. Brian commemorated this success by launching his very own music festival in Florida's 30a and participating in the 49th Annual CMA Awards. Brian is currently on a nationwide tour in support of his new single "Healing Highway" which is soaring up the country charts. - Submitted

events.Name: Richard Leigh, Adam Falcon and Pat Alger
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, BLUES + JAZZ + SWING, COUNTRY
events.Summary: Richard Leigh, Adam Falcon and Pat Alger will play Douglas June 11th at 9PM. The cover is $10.
events.Description: Richard Leigh, who has been writing songs since he was ten years old and professionally since he was twenty-three, got his first break in 1976 when Crystal Gayle released "I’ll Get Over You", and took it to #1 on Billboard’s Country Chart. This was made all the sweeter when it garnered Leigh his first, of now seven, Song Of The Year nominations, this one from the Country Music Association (CMA).  Two years later, in 1978, Leigh was back at the CMA’s, this time to take home the Song Of The Year award for "Don’t It Make My Brown Eyes Blue" which itself has had a phenomenal career: this Leigh composition reached the #1 position on both Pop and County charts and remained on the charts for more than six months. It was nominated at the 20th Grammy Awards in both the Pop and Country Best Song categories (a feat not repeated again until 1993).  It won a Grammy Award for Best Country Song and became a million selling single, and was named one of the ten most performed Country Songs Of The Century at the 1999 ASCAP Awards. In addition to his own three Grammy Nominations, five of Leigh’s songs have become vehicles to the Grammy Awards for other artists in the Best Performance, Record of the year, and Vocal Event categories. To date, Leigh has made fourteen trips to the Top Ten and has written or co-written nine #1 singles: the hauntingly beautiful "Somewhere In My Broken Heart" (written with Billy Dean), voted 1991 Song Of The Year by the Nashville Songwriter’s Association (NSAI), and also by the Academy Of Country Music (ACM); "Only Here For A Little While", (written with Wayland Holyfield);  "The Greatest Man I Never Knew" (written with Layng Martine, Jr.), nominated at the 1993 Grammy Awards for Best Country Song); "Come From The Heart" (written with Susanna Clark and recorded by Kathy Mattea); Don Williams’ "Thats The Thing About Love" (written with Gary Nicholson); Steve Wariner’s "Life’s Highway" (written with Roger Murrah); Mickey Giley’s "Put Your Dreams Away" (written with Wayland Holyfield), and the aforementioned “I’ll Get Over You” and “Don’t It Make My Brown Eyes Blue”, both written solely by Leigh and recorded by Crystal Gayle. Pat Alger:  With well over 20 hits to his credit, including eight #1 hits and having played venues all over the world, including a year long tour as opening act for the Everly Brothers Pat Alger is well known in the music industry. Two of the most famous songs written by Pat Alger are “Unanswered Prayer” and “Thunder Rolls” co-written with Garth Brooks before Garth was the ‘Garth Brooks’. “What’s She’s Doing Now” and “That Summer” were two other #1 Hits Pat and Garth wrote.   Other great classics Pat Alger is responsible for are “Once In A Very Blue Moon”, “Lone Star State of Mind, and “Goin Gone” for Nanci Griffith. Adam Falcon:  As a teenager, he played in countless bars and clubs throughout the city with numerous bands. At 17, he’d written his first song for the legendary jazz guitarist George Benson, but being too shy to present the song, it wasn’t until 10 years later that the late, iconic music producer, Arif Mardin, heard the song and decided to have Benson record it for Warner Brothers Records. That song is called “In Search Of A Dream” from the Grammy nominated album “In Your Eyes." At the age of 21, Falcon embarked on a national tour, playing for an act, opening for the Bee Gees. That experience sparked Falcon’s musical career. Some of the artists that he’s worked and/or shared the stage with are Roberta Flack, Sophie B. Hawkins, Whitney Houston, B.B. King, Eric Clapton, Jim Lauderdale, Robert Palmer, Phyllis Hyman, Peter Gabriel, and Nona Hendryx. “Either recording an album for The Village People or playing with Jonathan Butler on The Tonight Show With Johnny Carson, it was one big musical trip” says Falcon.

events.Name: Donelson Songwriter's Night
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, AMERICANA + BLUEGRASS + FOLK, COUNTRY, FREE
events.Description: Make plans to be there for the Taproom's 2nd installment of the Donelson Songwriter's Night! All 3 featured artists are either residents of the Hip community or have made Homegrown their neighborhood taproom: Mandy Cook, Steven Nix, and Annie Mosher! Mandy Cook is the soulful daughter of Blues and Jazz, with a little R&B thrown in for good measure. Her haunting melodies and smooth voice transport the listener back to a bygone era, when music was a little sweeter. At once cold and beautiful, darkly enchanting, richly heartfelt and always mysterious. Steven Nix is a singer/songwriter based out of Nashville, Tennessee by way of Brookhaven, Mississippi. He was signed with BMG in early 2014 and has been writing professionally since then. Steven continues to share sessions with some of the most prominent writers in the business. He has 2 top 10 singles on Gospel radio, has written multiple jingles for major networks, and has landed the theme song for a brand new show on QVC. You can find Steven at different venues in Nashville most any day entertaining tourists and locals. If you ask him he is certainly living his dreams. Annie Mosher grew up in the northernmost part of rural Vermont where she began writing songs as a child. She later travelled the country following the rodeo and writing music inspired by the souls she met and worked with from the Texas hill country to the mountains of Wyoming. Her song "Goldfish" was recently produced and recorded by British pop icon and Beatles producer Alan Parsons. She is a winner of the Texas Wildflower Music Festival, a beloved regular at Nashville's own Bluebird Cafe, and a longtime member of the sassy Nashville-based group Girls With Guitars. Wild and witty, provocative and poignant, Annie Mosher is an artist like no other. Ultimately, when it comes to describing the captivating presence that is Annie Mosher, words fail. - Submitted.

events.Name: CMA Benefit for Fallen Heroes Family Camp ft. Billy Dawson, Waylon Payne, Lila McCann & MORE
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, CMA MUSIC FESTIVAL, COUNTRY
events.Description: CMA Benefit for Fallen Heroes Family Camp will feature Billy Dawson, Waylon Payne, Lila McCann, Andrea Pearson, Blue County, Gary Chapman and SPECIAL GUESTS! Fallen Heroes Family Camp is completely free for surviving family members who have lost a loved one in service to America. All activities, food lodging and transportation are provided to participants, thanks to the generosity and support from caring individuals, companies and fundraising events by volunteers. The families are chosen by Fort Campbell and is hosted by JML Farms, Springfield, Tn. - Nestled in a peaceful rural setting just a few scenic miles from Nashville. At Fallen Heroes Family Camp, families have little time to focus on grief. Instead their days are filled as they learn to ride, rope and work around the horses at the farm. They are making new friends and find a renewed focus on living lives that remember and honor their Fallen Heroes. Fallen Heroes Family Camp is a 501 (c) 3 non-profit tax exempt organization.

events.Name: Sons of Zevon Present 1975 ft. Jamie Rubin, Audley Freed, Kevin Hornback, Marc Pisapia & MORE
events.Description: Sons Of Zevon began as an informal gathering of musicians in Nashville who paid tribute to the recently deceased Warren Zevon by playing an entire night of his songs at their local pub. It was meant to be a one-night-only event, but they had so much fun that Neil Young and Tom Petty nights followed. Next came talk about the great diversity of radio in the 1970s, and the current objective of the band was born: choose one year from the 1970s, and play a variety of songs that came out that year. Over the past several years, the band – comprised of Jamie Rubin, Audley Freed, Kevin Hornback, Jen Gunderman, and Marc Pisapia – has played through the entire decade, year by year. Each year features a different set of songs, singers, and additional instrumentalists, and the chronological arrangement of the shows lets audiences experience the development of music during arguably the most creative and rapidly changing decade in American music.

events.Name: The Springs Fan Club Party
events.Description: Calling all Frans (friends + fans = frans)!  Frans will enjoy live performances and special edition gifts! What do you get when you pair Stewart Halcomb and Holly Helms together? Along with tight harmonies, sure-footed songwriting direction, high energy shows, authenticity, and undeniable chemistry, you ultimately get - The Springs. At just 23 and 26, the driven pair is carving out a place of longevity in Music City. Featuring both male and female vocals, The Springs come packed with an always growing fan base. The versatile multi-award winning duo delivers Country, Southern Rock, Pop, and traditional favorites, offering something for the whole family. The Springs have shared the stage with some of country music’s top recording acts including Florida Georgia Line, Thompson Square, Jake Owen, Josh Turner, Gary Allan, Hunter Hayes, Love and Theft, Mark Wills, Little Big Town, Eric Church, Alan Jackson, Toby Keith, Charlie Daniels and Easton Corbin. As down to earth as they are talented, The Springs enjoy interacting with their fans of all ages. Their fans have taken on the name “Springsters”, and have truly become more than just “fans” to The Springs. Stewart & Holly actually call their fans, “frans” (friends + fans = frans) because they truly feel a personal friendship between each fan. After each show they stay to make sure they sign autographs and take pictures with everyone that comes (many times 4-6 hours) to let each “fran” know how much they mean to them. -TheSpringsBand.com

events.Name: Diva Jam
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, CMA MUSIC FESTIVAL, COUNTRY, FREE
events.Description: Diva Jam 2016 hosted by Olivia Lane features live music by Megan & Liz, Rachelle Lynae, April Kry, Rae Solomon, Sandra Lynn, Stephanie Quayle, and Mary Sarah. If there’s one thing that stands out about Olivia Lane, it’s her pure, unbridled energy. It’s reflected in her big, dynamic voice; in her performance, which bursts with passion and levity; and by her simple presence, which can dissolve you in laughter and make you grin from ear to ear. Not every day does an artist come around able to so effortlessly meld a freewheeling spirit with poignant, inspirational songs and an irrepressible drive, but Lane’s one of them. Because she knows as well as anyone how easily music can inspire a smile. A love for country music and songcraft pushed her to go to Nashville – she came to Tennessee on internships while in college, and then, right after her graduation, she packed up her car and drove cross-country to make her relationship with the town official. Immediately, she started getting to know writers and spending time in writing rooms, composing songs like “Steal Me Away” (written with Lee Thomas Miller and Toshinsky) from her Love Thing EP, that introduced the world to who Olivia Lane is: a bold, brave, positive force ready to shake up the country music scene with her songs. -OliviaLaneMusic Facebook

CMA Music Festival™ 2016 four-day ticket packages include:

  • Star-packed NIGHTLY CONCERTS at Nissan Stadium, home of the Tennessee Titans
  • DAILY CONCERTS at Riverfront Stage, including early admittance into the venues
  • Stage-front PHOTO LINE access at Nissan Stadium and Riverfront Stages
  • DAILY AUTOGRAPH SIGNINGS at the Fan Fair X Exhibit Hall at Music City Center

events.Name: Dan Monaco
events.Description: Join Cafe Fontanella for dinner, drinks, and a little bit of music with the On Stage Music Series at Fontanel Nashville. Dan Monaco performs. Dan is a Nashville-based singer-songwriter who cut his teeth in Chicago. He has humbly graced the stages at The Metro, House of Blues Chicago, Cubby Bear, Hard Rock Cafe, and Debonair Social Club with various bands and artists. Dan is one of 23 featured artists on “The Originals,” the second of Nashville label Fontanel Records’ albums, released December 2015. Additionally, Dan has toured or performed with Nashville artists Betsy Kingston & Dixie Down, Jessica McNear, Morgan Alexander, and The Misters. Dan assimilates his style of playing in a wide range of musical genres. A classically trained vocalist and jazz pianist, Dan earned his bachelor's degree in music education at the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign) and taught K-8 general music for five years. Dan is a multi-instrumentalist and keyboard specialist with influences ranging from Jamie Cullum and J. Roddy Walston & The Business to Allen Toussaint and Gary Clark, Jr.

She incorporates her gospel roots into her soulful performances.
