The room will then be cleared for the Writers Night that follows. We do not take reservations for this show. Seats are first come, first served. This show is sponsored by the RIAA.

events.Name: Writers Night Hosted by Steve Goodie with special guest Tom Hambridge
events.Summary: Join The Bluebird Cafe for Writers Night with special guests!
events.Description: Writers Night hosted by Steve Goodie with special guest Tom Hambridge.

events.Name: NJW Jam Session
events.Description: The NJW Jam Session is a monthly community event hosted by Evan Cobb or Matt Endahl. Taking place every third Sunday of the month (typically), the popular session is a fertile ground for the large contingent of great jazz players and enthusiasts in Middle Tennessee. Geared for professionals, serious students of jazz, and those who love to listen, this jam session is a chance for players to hear each other, meet, and collaborate. The NJW Jam Session is an open forum, so we encourage listeners to ask questions. Each month a different featured guest leads the band and calls tunes. The event is completely FREE, but we do pass around a tip jar. A few rules for newcomers: 1. First time players cannot use a real book! 2. If you're bringing an arrangement or original, please have printed copies transposed for E-flat, B-flat, and bass clef instruments. 3. Vocalists! If you're singing an uncommon tune or even a common tune in a strange key, it's best to bring charts for the rhythm section and horn players. 4. The jam is fully backlined with amps and drums, but please bring your own cords and drumsticks. 5. Soft drinks are available for purchase. All other food and beverages are BYO This month's jam session is hosted by pianist Matt Endahl, with special guest TBA.

events.Name: The Eldon Thacker Show
events.Summary: A LIVE radio event guest appearing Nicole Atkins
events.Description: Come be a part of the journey back to "old skool" LIVE radio with The Eldon Thacker Show! The multi-faceted show complete with comedy parodies and hip Americana / Indie / Retro playlists, takes listeners back to a time when radio had us captivated with its characters. The Eldon Thacker Show began as a personal tribute to Nashville’s WLAC, the giant 50K WATT AM station whose signal powered out variety shows, R&B, rock ‘n roll, and original roots-rock into 28 states from the 1930’s thru the 50’s, 60’s and 70’s. Eldon Thacker has been compared to the likes of Dr. Demento, the legendary “John R” Richbourg and “Hoss” Allen, two of the great and original icons of WLAC, and the late, great, Wolfman Jack, all rolled into one fiery music preacher spreading the good word about the virtues of live radio and quality Americana music from all over the world. The Eldon Thacker Show is 100 percent live and broadcasts every Sunday from 7-9p central on ALT 983, WLAC 1510 and the iHeartRadio smarty phone app.

events.Name: Nashville Sunday Night | The Cactus Blossoms
events.Summary: Every Sunday night, Lightning 100 brings you our critically acclaimed live concert series featuring national, regional and local artists. The show broadcasts live from 3rd & Lindsley on Sundays from 8-10pm.
events.Description: When my brother and I started making music as The Cactus Blossoms there wasn’t a big plan. We cut our teeth performing some well known and obscure country songs that were popular or unpopular pre-1960, partly out of curiosity and deep appreciation, but mostly because it was fun. Early on we were given a residency at the Turf Club in St. Paul, Minnesota. We got a band together and it became our weekly practice-in-public where we would pull out every song we could think of, no matter how well we knew it. It was our first chance to play all night and do whatever we wanted. Over the course of our year and a half at the Turf Club our repertoire had snowballed into an amalgam of original songs and a bunch of gut wrenching, tongue-in-cheek heartbreakers, that were 30 years older than us. Not everyone could tell what was new and what was old, and it didn’t really matter. People just seemed to enjoy it. That’s when the wheel got going and gave the illusion of spinning backwards. We weren’t born in the wrong era. We just got into some music from a different era and found a way to make it our own. Good fortune has followed us every step of the way, offering opportunities that seemed just beyond what we’re ready for. It always stretches us out and makes us feel lucky as hell. When JD McPherson called and said he was interested in producing our record, it was the latest in a series of serendipitous events that brought us to where we are today. We opened for him at a gig in our hometown Minneapolis a few months earlier and had met him briefly, but never could have imagined that within a year we would be collaborating on a new album and criss-crossing America on tour with his band. JD is a music connoisseur with the singing voice of an angel, the boundless creative energy of a child, a scholar’s mind and the auditory perception of a wolf. This guy was the guy. He wanted to do something sparse and rhythmic with simple melodic arrangements and it lined up perfectly with the direction our new songs were leading us. We wanted to record live with the best rhythm section we could find, in one room, playing together while we sang. It’s not the easiest process, but it’s the way we wanted to capture the music. JD pointed us to Chicago and enlisted the talents of engineer/drummer Alex Hall, guitarist Joel Paterson, and bassist Beau Sample. It felt like a musical dream team, but we had no idea what would happen. We barely knew these guys and they barely knew our music. On the morning of our first session Alex was setting up microphones and running cables through his vents from the living room down to the control room in the basement. The rest of us were drinking coffee in the kitchen and making small talk. JD was running back and forth cracking jokes, trying to decide what song was best to do first. Within a couple of hours “Queen Of Them All” was finished, and everyone knew we were in the right place at the right time. The result, You’re Dreaming, is the culmination of several years of songwriting and the kindness of thousands of miles and friends. With a cast of characters, experiences, and personal perspectives, set in simple rhymes and sung in harmony, we try to paint a picture in your mind.

events.Name: Huey Lewis & the News
events.Summary: Huey Lewis & The News returns to Nashville! There last visit here sold out, so get your tickets quick!
events.Description:
Back by popular demand! After their last sold-out appearance at the Schermerhorn, one of America’s great rock ’n’ roll bands returns to sing all the hits you know and love:

  • The Heart of Rock & Roll
  • Do You Believe in Love
  • I Want a New Drug
  • The Power of Love
  • Hip to Be Square
  • Heart and Soul
  • Stuck with You
  • Jacob’s Ladder
  • If This Is It

events.Name: Pere Ubu 'Coed Jail!' Songs from 1975-1982
events.Description: The ‘Coed Jail!’ tour will draw on material from the two recent box set releases, ‘Architecture Of Language, 1979-1982’ and ‘Elitism For The People, 1975-1978’ (Fire Records). Tracks from the debut album ‘Modern Dance’ through to their “the scariest album ever recorded”, ‘New Picnic Time’, will be played in a fast-moving hour and a half long set.

events.Name: Mike Mueller
events.Summary: Natchez Hills is all about Music and Wine!
events.Description: Rhythm and Vine is a music series every Saturday and Sunday in the tasting room or on the patio depending on the weather. This free concert series will showcase some regular performing artists as well as new and upcoming Nashville Talent. So grab your friends and come spend the weekends with a bottle of wine and Rhythm & Vine. Mike Mueller performs.  From the heart of Dairyland USA comes country music’s next big thing. Mike Mueller grew up on 80’s Hair Metal and 90’s Pop and Rock music, until he started his job as a farm hand at 12 where he fell in love with country music. “I had never listened to country music before I started working on the farm and one of the first songs I heard on the radio was George Strait's Write This Down. I was hooked immediately.” As Mike got older he fell more and more in love with performing and writing country music, so he set his sights for Nashville, August 2014. Unfortunately, a person does not just come to Nashville and a couple months later become a superstar. There is a lot of hard work that gets put into the craft and a network of loyal people you need to build relationships with to make things work and Mike did just that when he moved. Mike has been critically acclaimed by country superstars Florida Georgia Line for his cover of their multiplatinum hit single, Cruise on his YouTube page (muellertime100), which has led to endless opportunities. He has gotten to know staff members over at Big Loud Shirt Publishing to point him in the right direction and meet and write with some of the biggest people in town. While Mike is still an act in the making and gaining experience, every opportunity he gets he makes the most of. He provides and upbeat good/fun vibe to his live shows that connects directly with his audience. Mike is beginning to set up his tour for the summer and fall of 2016 and hopes to travel all across the country to continue to grow his fan base organically. As he continues to grow as an artist and songwriter, he plans to stay true to his country roots to provide quality entertainment and an up-tempo vibe for any occasion.

events.Name: Jesse Isley with Mac Leaphart and Larissia Murphy
events.Description:
Nashville guitar slinger Jesse Isley has played guitar since he was 11 years old and performed his first original concert at 16. Born and raised in Columbia, SC, Isley majored in music in college and was an active musical force throughout the Carolinas. In 2012, he re-located to Nashville, where he continues to perform and work as a studio session player. 

Isley toured as lead guitarist for grammy award nominated songwriter, Will Hoge. Over the years he has played for acts including Mark Collie, Bryan White, Tanya Tucker, Billy Bob Thornton, Keith & Kristyn Getty and more. Isley has appeared on many stages across the country, including the Grand Ole Opry and The Late Show with David Letterman. In spring 2015, he traveled with pop artist Danika Portz through the Persian Gulf, entertaining U.S. and Allied troops on an Armed Forces Entertainment Tour.

events.Name: The Entity w/ These Vices, Conquer the Distance, These Scarred Hands
events.Description: The Entity, These Vices, Conquer the Distance, and These Scarred Hands perform.

events.Name: The Time Jumpers
events.Description: The TIME JUMPERS are an award winning Western Swing band from Nashville, Tennessee, with two awards from the Association of Western Artists, one from the Western Music Association and two Grammy nominations! This group of Nashville's studio elite has evolved from casual jam sessions at the Grand Ole Opry to performing on the main stage, and becoming THE Monday night destination in Nashville. Their individual recording and performing credits cover virtually the entire history of country music, ranging from Slim Whitman to Carrie Underwood, and their members have recorded extensively with artists in other genres as well, from Barbra Streisand to Megadeth. Their combination of tight arrangements, soulful singers, brilliant soloists, and an irresistibly swinging rhythm section have packed their weekly performances at Nashville's legendary Station Inn for close to ten years, drawing not only their peers, such as fellow recording musicians Glen Worf, Brent Mason, Reggie Young, Bob Moore and countless others, but an amazingly diverse array of stars, including Jimmy Dean, Vince Gill, Amy Grant, Jimmy Buffet, Reba McEntire, Robert Plant, BJ Thomas, The White Stripes, Kings of Leon, Luna Halo, Norah Jones, John Rich, Robben Ford, Ronnie Dunn, Bonnie Raitt, Ronnie Milsap and Kelly Clarkson. The list goes on and on!

events.Name: String Theory | by Craig Havighurst
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, COMMUNITY, CULTURAL, HISTORY + HERITAGE, LECTURES + DISCUSSIONS, STAGE, THEATRE
events.Summary: A multi-media show about building a life in music and learning to listen. Presented by WHO KNEW.
events.Description: String Theory, the one-man show about music by writer and broadcaster Craig Havighurst, debuts at its new home, the lounge at Nashville’s City Winery. The event is presented by the acclaimed speaker series WHO KNEW and is part of a new wave of thought leadership and innovative performance in Nashville. String Theory, which grew out of a 2012 TEDx Nashville talk, is a multi-media monologue designed to shake up how you listen and what you listen to – a reboot and reimagining of music appreciation featuring a blend of sound, spoken word, science and art. Craig distils lessons from a life as an amateur musician and a music journalist/documentarian into a 90-minute event, followed by an open conversation and social listening in the comfortable City Winery lounge. Havighurst is a multi-media author and long-time journalist who’s written or produced for NPR, the Wall Street Journal, The Tennessean, No Depression, The Bluegrass Situation, Acoustic Guitar and other outlets. He’s put equal weight on covering artistry and the business of media and music, with emphasis on technology and cultural change. His book Air Castle of the South is the definitive account of how radio station WSM achieved greatness and made Music City possible. Havighurst is a founding producer and the show journalist/interviewer for Music City Roots. And he is the “History Guy” at the Nashville speaker series WHO KNEW, which is presenting partner for this edition of the String Theory show. WHO KNEW is Nashville’s bimonthly speaker series featuring personal accounts of creative career making and cultural change. Sold-out WHO KNEW events have hosted some of the most innovative minds and top executives in the music industry. Speakers have included A&R legends like Tom Zutaut and Scott Hendricks, elite music supervisors such as Anastasia Brown and Steve Schnur, artists like Matthew Perryman Jones, Gabe Dixon and Alanna Royale, a host of entrepreneurs of all shapes and sizes and representatives from some of the biggest players in the industry including Warner Music Group, Creative Artists Agency (CAA), Pandora and Spotify.

events.Name: Selena Gomez | Revival Tour
events.TicketInfo: Tickets onsale October 17, 2015 at 10 a.m. Presale info: Citi cardmembers & Selenagomez.com music store customers will have access to a presale beginning Tuesday, October 13th at 9:00 am via citiprivatepass.com.   For more information regarding early ticket access and other exclusives, visit http://smarturl.it/REVIVALTour.
events.Description: “The Revival Tour” will follow the October 9th release of Selena Gomez's new album “Revival” via Interscope Records. The lead single “Good For You” recently topped the Top 40 Radio Charts for three consecutive weeks. Gomez, who has sold over 22 million singles worldwide, embarks on her first tour since the sold out 2013 “Stars Dance Tour.”

events.Name: Grand Ole Opry feat. Charlie Daniels Band, Del McCoury Band, and more
events.Description: The Grand Ole Opry is the show that made country music famous. The Opry features a dynamic line-up of new stars, superstars, and legends of country music. Unlike a typical concert, the Opry presents eight or more artists on each show, giving the audience a sample of each artist's musical style. Only the Opry... there's nothing quite like it anywhere else! Scheduled to perform tonight at the Opry are: Charlie Daniels Band, Del McCoury Band, and more Schedule Changes: The lineup for each Grand Ole Opry show is not completely finished until just a few days before the show. Artists are posted to the Opry website as soon as appearances are confirmed (artists and schedule subject to change). Plan to check back often, as most times artists' appearances are not confirmed until one to two weeks prior to the show date.

events.Name: The Eagle Rock Gospel Singers
events.Description: Will Wadsworth formed The Eagle Rock Gospel Singers in the winter of 2010 following a failed relationship, a band dissolution and a scary airplane ride. In order to respark his interest in music, he and his roommate, Jeremy Horton, gathered friends together to sing old Gospel songs. They sang songs inspired by their love of Washington Phillips, The Staples Singers, Mahalia Jackson, Sister Rosetta Tharpe – you know, the real classics – and held house parties just so they could perform.

events.Name: Make Music Nashville
events.Description: Nashville Zoo is once again taking part in Make Music Nashville! Make Music Nashville is an all-day festival taking place in various neighborhoods in Nashville, Tennessee on June 21st every year. Join us up at the Grassmere Historic Home and you can listen to various acts perform and even join in on a Harmonica Jam!

events.Name: Music and Memories Presents Amy Grant
events.TicketInfo: $65/Classic Admission$110/VIP AdmissionTickets On Sale Friday, April 22 at 11:00am
events.Description: The FiftyForward Martin Center is pleased to announce that Grammy-award winner Amy Grant will headline the 11th Annual Music and Memories concert on Tuesday, June 21 at 7:30 p.m. benefiting the FiftyForward Martin Center. Amy Grant's career spans more than 30 years and stretches from her roots in gospel to becoming an iconic pop star, songwriter, television personality and philanthropist. With three multi- platinum albums, six platinum albums and four gold albums, her total career album sales exceed 30 million. In addition to six Grammy Awards, Grant has earned 26 Dove Awards and has been honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. FiftyForward serves a vital need in our community by giving older adults a place to fellowship, find needed resources, and engage in community involvement. Currently, adults 65 years and older are the fastest growing demographic and the FiftyForward Martin Center is advancing their mission to meeting increased needs.

events.Description: The 84th round of East Side Storytellin,' now celebrating its 3rd year, features writer Joshua Moore and musician Jon Latham. On the 1st and 3rd Tuesday of every month in East Nashville, Chuck Beard brings together and hosts local writers and musicians in a spectacular show, East Side Storytellin’. Launched in November of 2012, East Side Storytellin’ has consistently showcased the best of what Nashville is about, while inviting everyone to take a break from their busy lives to join in the fun. events.Name: Nashville Unleashed | Trace Adkins with Runaway June
events.Description: An American singer and actor, Trace Adkins has been ripping up the charts for over 20 years.  With hit songs like ‘Ladies Love Country Boys’, ‘You’re Gunna Miss This’ and “No Thinkin’ Thing’, he is a true icon in the music industry.  With a true country voice that you won’t soon forget, he is the epitome of country music. Runaway June is making their way up the charts with their dynamic talent and phenomenal vocals.  This trio is made up of Naomi, the lead resident rocker, Hannah, the boho, mandolin playing, self-proclaimed hippy, and Jennifer, guitarist extraordinaire and California beach bum!  Nashville better make way for these fierce ladies as they make their star rise one rockin’ show at a time! It’s no secret that music can help you feel better.  That’s why Musicians On Call brings music to the people that need it most – hospital patients. Musicians On Call brings live and recorded music to the bedsides of patients in healthcare facilities.

events.Name: An Evening of Bluegrass w/Roland White & Diane Bouska
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, AMERICANA + BLUEGRASS + FOLK, FREE
events.Description: Roland White and Diane Bouska lead a crew of incredibly talented and Grammy winning Bluegrass musicians in a night of acoustic bluegrass classics. Roland came to Nashville playing with Bill Monroe and, later, Lester Flatt, having already had a successful career in Kentucky. He was nominated for many and won 2 Grammy Awards with Nashville Bluegrass Band in the 80's. He continues to teach, write, and inspire everyone in the inner circle of bluegrass!

events.Name: I Have a Voice: Tennessee’s African American Musical Heritage
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, CULTURAL, HISTORY + HERITAGE, MUSEUMS + GALLERIES, MUSIC
events.Summary: The Tennessee State Museum and the Tennessee Performing Art Center (TPAC) have collaborated to present museum visitors and theater audiences with an exhibition that gives a snapshot of Tennessee’s rich African American musical heritage.
events.Description:
The exhibition, I Have a Voice: Tennessee’s African American Musical Heritage, is free to the public and on view in the G Level Gallery in the lobby that connects the Tennessee State Museum and TPAC in the Polk Cultural Center.

From the Beale Street blues clubs in Memphis to the R&B scene on Nashville’s Jefferson Street to Knoxville’s Gem Theatre, the Volunteer State has been the birthplace of some of the most influential music in the world. This exhibit documents that development while giving the State Museum the opportunity to showcase many important items from its permanent collection.

events.Description: The inimitable Val Storey and Grammy Award winning producer, songwriter and artist, Carl Jackson bring together an all-star cast of pickers to bring their Classic Country sound to most Monday evenings at the Station Inn. With a nod to the Station Inn's ever-changing musical landscape, the band is appropriately called "New Monday." In addition to Val and Carl, it features a lineup of stellar musicians including the award winning Aubrey Haynie on fiddle, legendary steel guitarist Lloyd Green, amazing guitar and mandolin player Guthrie Trapp, excellent acoustic and electric bassist, Brad Albin and world class drummer and percussionist Larry Atamauak.

events.Description: Mike Henderson. Talented singer, songwriter (If The Jukebox Took Teardrops, Harder Cards), multi instrumentalist and multi band member. Is there anything he can’t do? It would seem, based on the aforementioned evidence, that the answer to that question is simply “no.” Plus, he obviously fronts the Mike Henderson Band (hence the name) and they play some of the best blues this side of the Mississippi. events.Name: David Parmley & The Cardinal Tradition
events.Description: David Parmley is native of southern California. He is a founding member of the internationally acclaimed, Bluegrass Cardinals. In 18 years, the Cardinals recorded fifteen separate projects, made appearances on the Grand Ole Opry, the Ralph Emory Show and performed at the White House for former President, Jimmy Carter. In 1994 David teamed up with banjo great, Scott Vestal to form Continental Divide. The rest is, as they say, "history". Known for his soulful voice and driving rhythm guitar, and exceptional skills as a producer, David has notched many awards, including: International Bluegrass Music Association's "Recorded Event of the Year" 1991 and 1995.

events.Description: Sign up for the Open Mic night! In order to sign up please call (615) 943-8168 between the hours of 11:00am and Noon CST on Monday. The names of the first 25 songwriters who call in to sign-up will be taken (each songwriter is allowed one guest). Writers who are on the list must be at the club and have checked in with the host by 5:15pm on that Monday evening in order to perform. Please remember the following guidelines as they remain in place: each participating writer will get the chance to play 1-2 original songs, solo or accompanied by no more than two others on stage. Drums and backing tracks are not allowed. There is a house Kawai digital piano that is available to use (88-weighted keys). But there is something very special about this particular one. The Lower Broadway Band is on and the club is packed with excited music fans watching, listening and dancing in total enjoyment. This five piece band was formed in 2010 by five of Nashville’s top singers and musicians. They have grown into a very special country, country rock and southern rock group. Often called “the best band in Nashville” by their devoted fans, the popular group features three very special lead singers and amazing four part harmonies. Front man Andy Layne an outstanding guitarist and singer, sings the majority of leads, bolstered by the best country singer in Nashville J D Edge on lead vocals and fiddle. Bandleader Kevin Wysong in addition to being a very accomplished guitarist and arranger oversees the band’s intricate harmony arrangements as well as singing stellar lead on various songs himself. -Reverb Nation

events.Name: The Doyle and Debbie Show
events.Summary: The Doyle and Debbie Show is sublime parody, simultaneously lampooning and idolizing country music's tradition of iconic duos and their subsequent battle of the sexes.
events.Description: The Doyle and Debbie Show is sublime parody, simultaneously lampooning and idolizing country music's tradition of iconic duos and their subsequent battle of the sexes. Bruce Arntson and Jenny Littleton wield the vocals of vintage country stars and the acting chops of Broadway veterans, taking audiences on a freewheeling joyride through a wickedly funny script and slew of equally hilarious original songs. Over the past two years, Doyle and Debbie have developed a rabid cult following in Nashville, many of whom have seen the show over a dozen times - everyone from theater-going professionals to college students who wouldn't be caught dead in a theater or a country bar.

events.Name: Full Moon Pickin' Party Season Pass
events.TicketInfo: $100/Season Pass; Includes Admission to all 6 Full Moon Pickin’ Party Events in 2016
events.Summary: Full Moon Pickin’ Parties – Celebrating 16 years of mighty fine bluegrass!
events.Description:
Friends of Warner Parks presents the 16th annual season of Full Moon Pickin' Parties running May through October 2016.

These laid-back, family-friendly fundraisers feature Middle Tennessee's finest bluegrass and roots music under the light of a full moon. Musicians and music lovers alike are invited to enjoy this beloved Nashville tradition. Pickers jam in circles under the trees and around the grounds, while three headlining acts perform on the main stage.

Food is available for purchase, and water, soft drinks, and up to four beers (for adults 21 and up) are included with admission. Glass, large coolers, and alcohol may not be brought into the event. Limited seating is available so we recommend bringing blankets or camping chairs. Dogs are welcome as long as they are kept on a leash no longer than six feet in length at all times. Bags and instrument cases are subject to search.

Full Moon Pickin' Party Sponsors and Partners include: Bridgestone, Bridgestone Americas Trust Fund, Logan’s Roadhouse, The Ensworth School, Blue Moon Brewing Company, DET Distributing Company, Highwoods Properties, Piedmont Natural Gas, Bainbridge Realty Group, Crichton Brandon Jackson & Ward, Metro Nashville Parks and Recreation, NowPlayingNashville.com, Parking Management Company, Production House of Nashville, Lightning 100 and Team Green Adventures.

Funds raised by ticket sales will go directly back into the Warner Parks. Your support will help protect and preserve the parks and provide educational programming at Warner Park Nature Center.

Please note: Event is held rain or shine.

events.Name: Blake Shelton: Based On A True Story
events.orgName: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
events.venueName: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
events.TicketInfo: $24.95/Adults (13+) $22.50/Seniors (60+), Students and AAA Members $21.50/Military $14.95/Youth (Ages 6-12) Free/Children 5 and Under
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ARTS, CMA MUSIC FESTIVAL, COUNTRY, MUSEUMS + GALLERIES
events.Description: Award-winning country music phenomenon Blake Shelton will be the subject of a career-spanning exhibition at the Country Music Hall of Fame® and Museum. Blake Shelton: Based on a True Story, which opens May 27, 2016, will explore the life and work of one of country music’s most popular and multi-dimensional artists. “I came to Nashville in 1994, and I've always been fascinated by the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum,” Shelton said. “I remember the first time I walked in there, I was blown away. To have my own exhibit is more than a dream come true, because I never dreamed it could happen! It’s crazy, is what it is. I couldn't be more excited or more honored than to be a part of the museum.” With his bold vocals and rugged allure, Shelton was destined for stardom. The exhibition will examine the star’s road to success, from his childhood to his move to Nashville as a teen, and from his multi-platinum recording breakthrough to becoming a national celebrity on NBC’s The Voice, where Shelton has been the coach of four champions over the show’s previous nine seasons. The country music superstar brought his honky-tonk roots to contemporary Nashville song craft, and he has since grown to be one of America’s most beloved celebrities. A range of artifacts, including stage wear, instruments, song manuscripts, photos, and personal items will help tell the story of Shelton’s struggles and triumphs.

events.Description: Musicians and writers and players of all types - this is where it's at! Tuesday nights are something special here at Kimbro's, in light of our one-of-a-kind Deconstructed Songwriter Night. Your host for the evening is Jake Anderson . Sign-ups start around 6, slots start at 7, you play 3 songs, and we'll be jammin' until the break of dawn! Our open mic night is very free-form... that means whatever your music bag is, bring it and share it with us. It'll be a night to remember and you'll see why people talk about it so much.

events.Name: Mellow Mic Night
events.Description: Midtown Nashville's newest open mic night located right behind Music row on 21st Ave.  Every Wednesday from 7-10.  Sponsored by Turtle Anarchy Brewery with $3 Turtle Anarchy pints all night.

events.venueName: Four Points By Sheraton Nashville Brentwood

You’ll enjoy drink specials to wet your whistle at the bar, The Edge @ 760, and experience the rush of an impromptu on-stage performance. What are you waiting for? Today is your day to shine!

events.secondaryType: MUSIC, CHRISTIAN + GOSPEL, COUNTRY, MUSIC, TOURS
events.Description: FREE TOURS of Trinity Music City takes you inside the TMC Church Auditorium, our television studio, WPGD-TV, our TMC Recording Studios and the former estate of country music legend, Conway Twitty. Come see the birthplace of Country Music Television (CMT) and where Ferlin Husky and Marty Robbins each had their own museums! Our tours run daily Wednesday through Saturday at 10:00am and 2:00pm. Groups of 10 or more can call ahead and reserve a time that suits your group. Our Gold, Frankincense & Myrrh Gift Shop offers the finest Christian gifts, books, music and many more items to enhance your walk with Christ. We also carry great witness wear, novelties and beautiful collectibles. Children will enjoy a visit to our "Kids' Corner", an area specially designed for them. Check out our Facebook page to see a sampling of some of our products! Our Gift Shop is open Tuesday through Saturday, 10:00am - 5:00pm. Call us at (615) 822-0093. Another FREE event: In our Virtual Reality Theatre, experience the incredible story of Jesus from His birth to the ascension in the motion pictures, "The Revolutionary I & II". The story of the Apostle Paul will stir you to a deeper commitment with Christ in the presentation of "The Emissary". "The Omega Code" is a contemporary, fictional story based on the book of Revelation. "One Night with the King" is the true story of Queen Esther. "Megiddo", a 20hour full length feature film shown by request only, and is an epic showdown that pits continent against continent, nation against nation, and brother against brother, in an all-out war of the worlds between pure good and ultimate evil. Also, in our Virtual Reality Theatre, you can walk through an actual recreation of the Via Dolorosa - an ancient street in the old walled city of Jerusalem, ending at the Hill of Golgotha. Our Virtual Reality Theatre is open Wednesday through Saturday, 10:00am - 5:00pm. Call (615) 822-8333 now!

events.Name: Dylan, Cash, and the Nashville Cats: A New Music City
events.orgName: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
events.venueName: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, ACOUSTIC + SONGWRITER, ARTOBER, COUNTRY, DOWNTOWN, MUSEUMS + GALLERIES, MUSIC
events.Description:
When Bob Dylan came to Nashville to make his classic album Blonde on Blonde, he brought unprecedented attention to the city’s ultra-talented musicians. Johnny Cash did the same with his network television show. This exhibit looks at the impact those events had on Music City and its Nashville Cats.

The exhibit, Dylan, Cash, and the Nashville Cats: A New Music City, opens with a brief biographical section on Dylan’s career prior to his 1966 arrival in Nashville and on the events that drew him to Music City. The exhibit also looks at the subsequent albums Dylan recorded in Nashville—John Wesley Harding, Nashville Skyline, and portions of Self Portrait.

The centerpiece of the exhibit is a series of 16 listening booths, each devoted to a Nashville Cat of the era—David Briggs, Kenny Buttrey, Fred Carter Jr., Charlie Daniels, Pete Drake, Mac Gayden, Lloyd Green, Ben Keith, Grady Martin, Charlie McCoy, Wayne Moss, Weldon Myrick, Norbert Putnam, Jerry Reed, Pig Robbins and Buddy Spicher. Each booth provides biographical information, archival photos and audio samples of the musicians’ signature licks on both rock and country recordings from the late 1960s and early ’70s.

events.Name: Live Music at Nashville Crossroads
events.Description: Head downtown to catch live music in one of Nashville's legendary honky-tonks, Nashville Crossroads. Music City is known to boast live music all day long, and this is the establishment where you'll find it, located right on Broadway! Check the website for up-to-date information on the artists scheduled to perform at "Nashville Crossroads".

events.Name: Live Music at Rippy's Smokin' Bar & Grill
events.Description: Head downtown to catch live music in one of Nashville's honky-tonks, Rippy's Smokin' Bar and Grill. Music City is known to boast live music all day long, and this is just one establishment of many to hear it. Located on Lower Broadway, this venue is filled with flat screens and an amazing open-air rooftop patio overlooking all the happenings on Broadway. It's situated across the street from Bridgestone Arena and within walking distance to any venue located downtown. Stop by Rippy's Smokin' Bar & Grill for tasty BBQ, live music and good times!

events.Name: Live Music at Robert's Western World
events.StartTime: Showtimes may vary. Please check with venue for complete schedule.
events.Description: Catch live music in one of Nashville's legendary honky-tonks, Robert's Western World. Located in the heart of Music City USA in the historic Lower Broadway District and in the shadow of the Mother Church of Country Music (The Ryman Auditorium), Robert's Western World is Nashville's undisputed home of traditional country music. If you long for the soulful sounds of the old-time, honky tonk crooners and cherish the music of stars such as Marty Robbins, Johnny Cash, Hank Williams, Roy Acuff, Ernest Tubb, Little Jimmy Dickens, Hank Snow, Patsy Cline, Loretta Lynn, Webb Pierce, Carl Smith, Carl Perkins, Johnny Horton and many, many more - you will feel you've stepped back in time at Robert's Western World. And you'll soon know the reason why Nashville Scene readers have consistently voted Robert's as the Best Honky Tonk in Music City.

events.Name: Live Music at Bootleggers Inn
events.Description: Bootleggers Inn has taken the history of prohibition, combined it with great music, and landed right in the heart of Downtown Nashville. Two floors of "bootlegging", live music, moonshine, whiskey barrels, mason jars, and fun.... Come join the newest Nashville tradition.

events.Name: Live Music at Legends Corner
events.Description:
Some will say that a trip to Nashville is never complete without visiting the tried and true honky-tonk saloons along downtown Broadway. While it's hard to go wrong in any of these gritty watering holes, Legends Corner stands out as one of the best! Country music record covers plaster the walls, but the real attraction is the bar's live music: Some of the city's finest contemporary acts make their mark onstage. The expanded drink menu and the cold beer keep regulars coming back. With one of the most prominent locations downtown (catty-corner from the Arena), Legends draws an equal mix of curious tourists and local barflies. While the dance floor seems to shrink a bit on weekends, don't be afraid to mosey on out and kick up your heels.!

Please visit Legends Corner Official Website to discover who is performing today!

events.Name: Live Music at Layla's Bluegrass Inn
events.secondaryType: MUSIC, AMERICANA + BLUEGRASS + FOLK, COUNTRY, FREE
events.Description:
Nashville is known worldwide as Music City USA. And the place to hear the true flavor of Nashville is in the "Honky Tonks Of Broadway". Layla's Bluegrass Inn is smack dab in the middle of these famous honky tonk saloons, offering much more than just Bluegrass music! Layla's is home to Country, Hillbilly, Rockabilly,Western, Americana, Bluegrass, Newgrass and many different styles appealing to music fans from all over the world! Many well known performers have graced the stage at Layla's Bluegrass Inn including: BR549, Hank Williams III, Th' Legendary Shackshakers, Drive-By Truckers, Gail Davies, Chris Scruggs, and Ralph Stanley to name a few. Whether it's an up-and-coming new artist honing their sound or a famous act revisiting their roots, you'll be face to face with some of the best live music in historic Music City USA!

Please visit Layla's Bluegrass Inn Official Website to discover who is performing today!

events.Name: Live Music at Tootsies Orchid Lounge
events.Description: Tootsies Orchid Lounge has two stages that host live local talent each day covering modern day country music artists as well as original work. Step into the world famous Tootsies Orchid Lounge for great live music in the middle of Nashville's Lower Broadway area.

events.Name: Live Music at B.B. King's Blues Club
events.orgName: B.B. King's Blues Club and Restaurant
events.venueName: B.B. King's Blues Club and Restaurant
events.Description: Let go of the honky-tonk and let the good times roll when you step into B.B. King's Blues Club, one of Nashville's finest live entertainment venues located in the heart of Downtown in "The District." In a city known for great music and entertainment, The District is an area established in the late 1980?s to promote the city's historic areas --2nd Avenue, Broadway and Printers Alley-- known for entertainment and arts. We are just blocks away from the Bridgestone Arena, Nashville Convention Center, LP Field and Nashville Music City Center.

events.StartTime: Showtimes may vary. Please check with venue for performance schedule.
events.Description: You will hear songs from Johnny Cash to Kings of Leon at Whiskey Bent Saloon - a fun place to go and let loose in Nashville, TN. Located on Broadway, you will not miss it because they are the Saloon where everyone is singing all night long. Visit Whiskey Bent Saloon's official website to see what performer is on stage today!

events.orgName: Bourbon Street Blues and Boogie Bar
events.venueName: Bourbon Street Blues and Boogie Bar
events.Description: Located downtown Nashville, in Historic Printers Alley, BSBBB is legendary for the best in live blues. Anyone who is anyone has jammed on our stage, and locals and visitors alike all know if you want real blues, this is the place to come!

events.Name: Live Music at Music City Bar
events.Description: Music City Bar & Grill is Nashville's premier late night country music bar for 21 and up only located near The Opryland Hotel main entrance. At The Music City Bar & Grill, they combine great service, incredible food (served nightly until 2:30 am), a large selection of draft and bottled domestic & imported beers, wine, spirits & cocktails_ with world class nightly music entertainment. Outdoor patio seating, juke box, pool table, and Nashville's best country music entertainment venue is waiting for you.

events.Name: Live Music at Paradise Park Trailer Resort
events.Description: Head downtown to catch live music in one of Nashville's unique honky-tonks, Paradise Park Trailer Resort. Music City is known to boast live music all day long, and this is just one establishment of many to hear it. Located right on Broadway, stop by for a bite and pitcher (late night or dinner) at Paradise Park Trailer Resort!

events.Name: Nashville Palace
events.Description: The legendary Nashville "Palace" once the home of the stars of "The Grand Ole Opry" and television shows such as "Hee Haw" and "Nashville Now" near Opryland, is now owned and operated by Jesse Lee Jones the proprietor of Robert's Western World "The Home of Traditional Country Music" in downtown Nashville, TN. Jesse Lee's goal is to bring the "Palace" back to the "Golden Era" of country music bearing in mind the stars that were born in that very place. It is also a goal to promote and perpetuate traditional country music and its history. It is Jesse Lee's belief that this is the music that made "Music City" and it is befitting to maintain and keep alive this art form that was born in Bristol,Tennessee, the birth place of country music, but made popular worldwide right here in Nashville. The Nashville "Palace" presented by Robert's Western World is now back open with the musical integrity that everyone has come to expect and appreciate when visiting Robert's Western World.

events.Name: Live Music at Honky Tonk Central
events.Description: Honky Tonk Central is Nashville's latest and greatest honky tonk on world famous 'Lower Broadway' in downtown Nashville, TN. with 3 full stories of live music, great food and great times, Honky Tonk Central is the destination stop when in Nashville.

events.Name: Hump Day Jazz with the Geary Moore Trio
events.Description:
Weekly Hump-day Jazz with the Geary Moore Trio!

A native of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, Moore lived and performed in the New York Metropolitan area for a number of years and now lives in Nashville.  His fluid, inventive and authentic style attest to the thoroughness of his background in Jazz, R&B and Pop music.  An accomplished composer as well as a master technician, Mr. Moore has composed a repertoire of “In the Pocket” type of original tunes.  He has recorded an album writing and arranging most of the tunes on his premier recording.

Mr. Moore has performed with numerous accomplished and highly respected musicians.  A protege of George Benson and Jimmy Ponder, he has performed with: Arthur Prysock, Peaches and Herb, Jon Faddis, Billy Drummond, Slide Hampton, T.S. Monk, John Lee, Bob Cranshaw, Mickey Roker, Phil Woods, Mulgrew Miller, Jackie McLean, Regina Bell, David “Fat Head” Newman, Willis “Gator Tail” Jackson, Jimmy Anderson, Dave Ubanks, Steve Nelson, Steve Turre, Ruth Brown, Jimmy McGriff, Gloria Coleman, Harold Vick, John Patton, Reggie Workman, Marvin “Smitty” Smith, Joe Ford, Chuck Jackson, Bootsie Barnes, Groove Holmes, Don Patterson, Steve Colson, Dr. Lonnie Smith, John Blake, Jr., Yoran Israel, Connie Lester, Dave Stryker, Charles Earland, Jack McDuff, Earl May and Claudio Roditi.

Cover starts at 6PM
Showtimes may vary. Please check with venue for complete schedule.
All ages welcome - family restaurant
21 over - after 10PM on Fridays & Saturdays
events.Description:
The Wildhorse Saloon is Nashville's #1 Dining and Entertainment destination and a mecca of entertainment in America. To capture the attention of Nashvillians and country music visitors, on June 1, 1994, the history of the World Famous Wildhorse Saloon began with country superstar Reba McEntire herding a stampede of live cattle through the streets of Music City, also known as Nashville, Tennessee. The cattle were herded down Second Avenue and past the front doors of the newly opened club. Since then, the Wildhorse has continued to capture the interest of visitors with its award-winning menu, unique attractions and one-of-a-kind capabilities.

Come out to the Wildhorse Saloon for some live music and line dancing!
